column3: UCD School of Mathematics and Statistics
column5: Graduate TaughtÂ (level 9 nfq, credits 90)The MSc Data & Computational Science course is aimed at students who wish to gain a deep understanding of applied mathematics, statistics and computational science at the graduate level. The course will equip such students with the skills necessary to carry out research in these computationally based sciences and will prepare them well for a career either in the industry or in academia. The taught modules in the course provide a thorough grounding in the areas of applied mathematics, statistics and computational science; all students complete project work in data and computational science with the option of (supervised) research dissertation.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
